meanings.definition: A condition characterized by color blindness, especially the inability to distinguish between red and green.
meanings.sent1: His daltonisms made it challenging for him to tell the difference between red and green.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with daltonisms after he struggled to identify colors correctly.
meanings.sent3: Despite his daltonisms, he still enjoyed painting with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: Her daltonisms painted her world in shades of confusion, like a blurry rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The daltonisms in his eyes turned the world into a puzzling canvas of mixed hues.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being color blind.
meanings.sent1: The daltonisms in his eyes affected his ability to see colors accurately.
meanings.sent2: She learned to embrace her daltonisms and see the world in a unique way.
meanings.sent3: His daltonisms added a colorful twist to his perception of the world.
meanings.sent4: The daltonisms of the artist's vision created a surreal masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: Despite his daltonisms, he found beauty in the monochromatic world around him.
